column1: Decreased factor X activity may be related to: - Disorder in which abnormal proteins build up in tissues and organs (amyloidosis) - Deficiency of factor X that is present at birth (congenital) - Disorder in which the proteins that control blood clotting become over active (disseminated intravascular coagulation) - Fat malabsorption (not absorbing enough fat from your diet) - Heparin use - Liver disease - Vitamin K deficiency - Taking the blood thinning drug called warfarin (Coumadin)
